Additionally, they may believe that the dam will provide a dependable source of water and electricity to the region, helping to mitigate the impacts of drought or energy shortages.

However, it is also important to consider that governments may face pressure from powerful interest groups, including businesses, investors, and international lenders, to pursue large-scale infrastructure projects like dams. These groups may see these projects as necessary for economic growth and development, and may provide funding or support for them.

Regardless of the motivations behind these decisions, it is important for governments to carefully consider the potential social and environmental impacts of large-scale infrastructure projects and to engage with local communities and environmental experts to explore alternative solutions.
